ratings.comment: He seems like a nice guy but not a good for lectures. Exams are more tedious than they should be for a intro course. No direction on what to study. There is extra credit so do that but wouldn't rec if you have to take this course. You cant look at what you got wrong on exams. Takes course way to serious for an intro course

I thought Professor Jensen was an absoltely amazing professor, he provided insightful materials and always strived for his students to learn more. His lectures were interesting and engaging, exams were challenging but pushed me and fellow classmates to work harder. I would reccomend taking his course, he is an incredible professor.

Despite the other not so great reviews, I really enjoyed Prof. Jensen's teaching style. He cares a great deal about his students and is happy and excited to meet students in office hours. I reading the book is INCREDIBLY important! Attendance at lecture was taken, but if you were to miss, looking over the lecture slides is a definite must.

Clint was a great professor. He was really down to earth, enthusiastic about the material, and (most importantly to me) understanding of extenuating circumstances. If you show up to his class and take notes, you'll be more than fine. Just show up, stay focused for the hour, and start studying at least a few days before the exam.

Clint's class is one of the best I have taken in the psychology department. The class felt more like a discussion where everyone could meaningfully contribute. The research paper was somewhat challenging but he provided consistent support, chances for success, and great detailed feedback. He was a very personable and nice instructor.

I've had Clint as a professor for Child Development or Psych 460. The material was presented in a clear way, and exam expectations were very clear. All material from the exams were clearly emphasized on the slides which made studying simple. There were some projects due over the course of the semester, but they were simple.

I had Clint for my psych capstone and it was by far my favorite course I have taken in the Psychology Department. It was clear he cared about our understanding of the subjects and wanted to know us all individually. As long as you put in effort to your assignments, it is easy to get an A. If you I highly recommend taking a course with Clint!

Great instructor! The class was a little difficult if you hadn't done the readings so definitely do those. The main thing is it was a little unorganized but it was overall a great course. The main grade was the final paper and that was not meant to be a difficult assignment if you had a solid plan. Definitely go to office hours for that paper.

Professor Jensen was incredibly kind and accessible outside of class. He offered multiple extra credits and was great at answering questions. The exams were challenging but bearable. Some questions were more difficult than others, but that's what goes into an exam anyway. I recommend doing the readings, as they helped immensely with the exams.

I don't understand why everyone here is hating. I thought he was a great professor, and as long as you showed up to lecture and did the readings, you were fine. I did minimal studying for this class, and just did all the assignments while reading the rubrics carefully and was fine. Grading sometimes took a while, but that's because there was one TA

He is kind and wants students to succeed. But he was not prepared for tests. Exam 2 was horribly written and everyone did bad. He does not help prepare for exams or give any guidance on topics. He was horrible at answering questions and everyone got frustrated. I once asked him a question and he responded so badly I was dumbfounded

I will say, it does seem like he really cares for his students and he is a very genuine person. However, exam expectations were extremely unclear and he gave you basically no direction on what to study. The exam questions were horribly written and confusing. The class average on the exams was way lower then it should have for this content.

I loved this class, one of the easiest psych courses. Clint was super engaging and seemed to really care about the content. TONS of extra credit options. I never opened the textbook and still did very well on exams. Just go to lecture and you'll be good.

I feel like he cared about his students but with his lack of experience he was unable to give people proper education. Even after studying for countless hours for an exam, I ended up receiving a D, due to the fact that his exam questions made no sense. When asked about the exam, he said that they were meant to trick you. Give me a break.

I don't know why a university that actually cares about its reputation would even hire this guy. He's so lazy that he didn't create any of his own assignments, and then also did not want to put grades into canvas, so nobody knew their grades until the semester was over. He is also so horrible at writing exam questions. Worst teacher I've had here.

WORST "professor" I have ever had. He is very unorganized and does not give clear expectations for assignments and will take points off for no reason. He is incredibly passive aggressive and rude with students. He grades you on your attendance and does not even have that listed in the syllabus. DO NOT take any class with him.

Unorganized and unclear expectations 24/7. "Participation" worth 20% of our grade was mandatory attendance with one "freebie" regardless of whether an absence was excused (this was decided when final grades were due) and not stated in the syllabus. Take 601 with a professor who knows what they're doing and supports students' success.
